text:
Am I the only one who always have troubles after updating Julia versions? Like no matter what I do, which guide I read, whether I use Atom or VSCode, something goes wrong? Since Julia 0.7 I don't think I've had one smooth upgrade (so clearly this is 99% on me)

Newest iteration:
```Pkg.instantiate()
ERROR: AssertionError: sourcepath !== nothing```
while running the file in 1.5.0 that worked one hour ago...

On the bright side: time to first plot down from 9 to 5 seconds on my machine - nice! :+1:

text: are you using a manifest generated with a different version of julia?

elements.text: are you using a manifest generated with a different version of julia?

text: what was the actual difference between 1.5 and 1.6 here?

elements.text: what was the actual difference between 1.5 and 1.6 here?

text: Yeah, either delete the manifest, or do `instantiate -p`

elements.text: Yeah, either delete the manifest, or do

text: I mean could we have automated/detected this in 1.6 and just save the manifest as a new 1.6 manifest

elements.text: I mean could we have automated/detected this in 1.6 and just save the manifest as a new 1.6 manifest

text: Yes, I guess that's it this time. I didn't mean to turn this channel in helpdesk, but should I then delete the manifest everytime I switch versions?

elements.text: Yes, I guess that's it this time. I didn't mean to turn this channel in helpdesk, but should I then delete the manifest everytime I switch versions?

text: unfortunately the version of julia used to generate a manifest isn't recorded anywhere

elements.text: unfortunately the version of julia used to generate a manifest isn't recorded anywhere

text: This is a common pitfall. I'm sure this is documented, but I'm not sure how to make it more accessible.

elements.text: This is a common pitfall. I'm sure this is documented, but I'm not sure how to make it more accessible.

text: generally speaking, manifests are specific to the minor version of julia you use to generate them.  switching minor version may warrant deleting the manifest

elements.text: generally speaking, manifests are specific to the minor version of julia you use to generate them.  switching minor version may warrant deleting the manifest
